title: Optical Studies of Correlated States in Twisted Monolayer-Bilayer MoTe2
description: Comprehensive optical investigation of twisted monolayer-bilayer (tML/BL) and bilayer-monolayer (tBL/ML) MoTe2 heterostructures (Sample B61) at low temperature (1.55 K) in an Attodry cryostat. The study uses polarization-resolved reflectance, RMCD, and photoluminescence (PL) to explore the rich phase space as a function of carrier density, electric displacement field (D), and magnetic field (B). Key findings include the observation of zero-field ferromagnetism (FM) at specific D-field values, correlated insulating states at both integer (-1) and fractional (-2/3, -1/3, etc.) fillings, and the determination of associated Chern numbers. The research also details the temperature dependence of these correlated states and maps out the FM domains using dual-gate control.

[Slide 19]
Current understanding
(1) The zero B FM is at tA/AB (higher energy resonance), and finite B weak magnetism is at tAB/A (lower energy resonance)
Explanation: based on previous measurements, E (tA/B)<E(tA/A)< E (natural AB), so tA/A interface is the lowest energy part in tA/AB, and tB/A is the lowest energy interface in tAB/A. Since E (tA/A)> E(tB/A), the tML/BL should be tA/AB and tBL/ML should be tAB/A.
The zero B FM at tA/AB (tML/BL) is at D = 0.1 V/nm, which is pointing from ML to BL, the offset is different from tA/A/A (1+1+1) structure (0.25-0.3 V/nm).
Explanation: the hybridization in tA/AB is weaker than tA/A/A. The different part is the D offset. D>0 at tA/AB is to push holes from ML to BL, which is effectively tBA/AB, where as tA/A/A is to push the holes to tA/A interface, effectively tA/A. The extend wing feature at tA/AB is at negative D, which is tA/A interface.
